property.name: text
property.value: At time 15, turn on a load.

property.name: text
property.value: This model checks the behavior against a specification that is given formally using hierarchical state machines that monitor the behavior for conformance.

property.name: text
property.value: An over-voltage threshold of 120 is exceeded during startup, and with this controller, the fault condition disables connecting the load.

property.name: text
property.value: Specification monitor here provides a violation signal if the spec is not me. The result will be an exception.

property.name: text
property.value: Specification here is not met by this implementation, so if the connection is made to the ThrowModelError actor, then an exception will result on running the model.

property.name: text
property.value: See also a messier version of this where the specification monitor is not an aspect, but is rather wired directly to the original model.

property.name: text
property.value:
This machine checks the inputs for conformance with a specification and outputs a violation if the inputs do not conform.
The specification in ordinary English: - with translations into local terminology.
If fault occurs, open contactor within X time regardless of other inputs and leave open (no reset) - fault == true => contactor == false within X time If switch is on, close contactor within Y1 time - onOff == true => contactor == true within Y1 time If switch is off, open contactor within Y2 time - onOff == false => contactor == false within Y2 time

property.name: text
property.value: Assumptions: - First requirement takes priority over the second. - A fault requires a contactor == false signal even if the load is already disconnected - Contactor is initially open. - The last two requirements are problematic: * time of fault == true or fault == false must be precise to meet these requirements * strict inequality

property.name: text
property.value:
Specification in ordinary English: - with translations into local terminology.
If input > threshold for Z1 time, fault output = true - voltage > threshold for Z1 time => fault == true If input < threshold for Z2 time, fault output = false - voltage < threshold for Z2 time => fault == false
